DOC.brief_summary: Trans Cranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS) over dorsal visual system will disturb the ability to identify objects with decreased level of fragmentation
DOC.brief_title: Interruption of Dorsal Visual Stream Using TMS
DOC.detailed_description: The participants performed two tasks under three different TMS conditions: no TMS, 10Hz TMS for over the dorsal stream (PO3 EEG site) or over the vertex. First they performed a perceptual closure task which asked them to identify an object in a series of six progressively less degraded pictures. Then, they also performed a control task previously shown not to be mediated by the LOC and not to be impaired in schizophrenia: The perception of illusory contours.
DOC.criteria: Normal controls neurological, ophthalmological or psychiatric problems family history of schizophrenia left handed
